scGenChMainAgPosition.name: scGenChMainAgPosition
scGenChMainAgPosition.description: This attribute defines the position in the chassis where the Main Agent resides.

scGenChRedunAgPosition.name: scGenChRedunAgPosition
scGenChRedunAgPosition.description: This attribute defines the position in the chassis where the Redundant Agent resides. 0 means Redundant Agent not present.

scGenChRedunAgActivityStatus.name: scGenChRedunAgActivityStatus
scGenChRedunAgActivityStatus.description: This attribute defines the status of the Redundant Agent. notPresent(1) - indicates that no redundant Agent exists. dormant(2) - indicates that the redundant Agent is ok and may at any moment become the Agent of the system. active(3) - indicates that the redundant Agent is acting as the Agent.

scGenChAgVLAN.name: scGenChAgVLAN
scGenChAgVLAN.description: The Virtual LAN number of the Agent's internal interface. The value 0 means Generic ( But can communicate with Global !). The values '255' mean Global.

scGenMonTable.name: scGenMonTable
scGenMonTable.description: Table of attributes which define Monitoring information about a single XSwitch in SC based devices.

scGenMonEntry.name: scGenMonEntry
scGenMonEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing data about a single XSwitch.

scGenMonSwitchId.name: scGenMonSwitchId
scGenMonSwitchId.description: Index which identifies the XSwitch for which this entry contains information. This value is never greater than chNumberOfXSwitches.

scGenMonDropEvents.name: scGenMonDropEvents
scGenMonDropEvents.description: The total number of events in which the probe could not count packets due to lack of resources. This number is not necessarily the number of packets dropped; it is just the number of times this condition has been detected.

scGenMonOctets.name: scGenMonOctets
scGenMonOctets.description: The total number of good octets switched and error octets filtered by this XSwitch.

scGenMonPkts.name: scGenMonPkts
scGenMonPkts.description: The total number of good packets switched and error packets filtered by this XSwitch.

scGenMonGoodBroadcastPkts.name: scGenMonGoodBroadcastPkts
scGenMonGoodBroadcastPkts.description: The total number of good packets switched by this XSwitch that were directed to the broadcast address.

scGenMonGoodMulticastPkts.name: scGenMonGoodMulticastPkts
scGenMonGoodMulticastPkts.description: The total number of good packets switched by this XSwitch that were directed to the multicast address. Note that this number does not include packets directed to the broadcast address.

scGenMonGoodPkts.name: scGenMonGoodPkts
scGenMonGoodPkts.description: The total number of good packets switched by this XSwitch.

scGenMonBadPkts.name: scGenMonBadPkts
scGenMonBadPkts.description: The total number of bad packets filtered by this XSwitch.

scGenMonGoodOctets.name: scGenMonGoodOctets
scGenMonGoodOctets.description: The total number of good octets switched by this XSwitch.

scGenMonBadOctets.name: scGenMonBadOctets
scGenMonBadOctets.description: The total number of bad octets filtered by this XSwitch.

scGenMonSmonCapability.name: scGenMonSmonCapability
scGenMonSmonCapability.description: This item is used to define which smon's application are implemented in the agent. When the console first performs smon application it should read this item in order to know which of the smon's applications are available in this agent's version. When there is a value of 0 (zero) in the relevant bit it means that the assosiated application is not supported, When there is a value of 1 (one) in the relevant bit it means that the assosiated application is supported. D0 - Statistics. D1 - History. D2 - Alarms. D3 - Host. D4 - HostTopN. D5 - Metrix. D6 - Filter. D7 - Capture. D8 - Event. D9 - TokenRing. D10 - ProtocolDir. D11 - ProtocolDist. D12 - AddressMap. D13 - NlHost. D14 - NlMatrix. D15 - AlHost. D16 - AlMatrix. D17 - UsrHistory. D18 - ProbConfig. D19 - Port. D20 - PortTopN. D21 - Subnet. D22 - SubnetMatrix. D23 - Vlan. D24 - VlanMatrix. D25 - nlHostTopN D26 - portHistory

scGenMonMIBCtrMode.name: scGenMonMIBCtrMode
scGenMonMIBCtrMode.description: This object defines for switch ports to include/exclude local segment traffic in their port counters

scGenMonSwitchVLANList.name: scGenMonSwitchVLANList
scGenMonSwitchVLANList.description: A bitmap defining the status of the virtual LANs in the Virtual LAN Table. The first bit is for Virtual LAN 0, the second for Virtual LAN 1, and so on. If the Virtual LAN exists in the hub the value of the associated bit is 1, otherwise 0.

scGenMonMIBCtrList.name: scGenMonMIBCtrList
scGenMonMIBCtrList.description: A bitmap defining the status of the MIBCtrMode for every group in the switch. The MSB (Most significant bit) representing the status of group #1. If MIBCtrMode on a group is enable(1) the bit is set to 1, otherwise 0.

scGenMonTimeStamp.name: scGenMonTimeStamp
scGenMonTimeStamp.description: This attribute contains the value of sysUpTime at the time switch counters were calculated.

scGenMonVlanTimeStamp.name: scGenMonVlanTimeStamp
scGenMonVlanTimeStamp.description: This attribute contains the value of sysUpTime at the time VLAN counters were calculated.

scGenMonPriorityTable.name: scGenMonPriorityTable
scGenMonPriorityTable.description: A list of priority count entries.

scGenMonPriorityEntry.name: scGenMonPriorityEntry
scGenMonPriorityEntry.description: A list of statistics related to a specific priority level on a single XSwitch in SC based devices.

scGenMonPrioritySwitchId.name: scGenMonPrioritySwitchId
scGenMonPrioritySwitchId.description: Index which identifies the XSwitch for which this entry contains information. This value is never greater than chNumberOfXSwitches.

scGenMonPriorityId.name: scGenMonPriorityId
scGenMonPriorityId.description: The priority for which this entry reports statistics. 1=regular. 2=high.

scGenMonPriorityGoodPkts.name: scGenMonPriorityGoodPkts
scGenMonPriorityGoodPkts.description: The total number of good packets switched by this XSwitch using this packet priority level.

scGenMonPriorityGoodOctets.name: scGenMonPriorityGoodOctets
scGenMonPriorityGoodOctets.description: The total number of good octets switched by this XSwitch using this packet priority level.

scGenMonVLANList.name: scGenMonVLANList
scGenMonVLANList.description: A bitmap defining the status of the virtual LANs in the Virtual LAN Table. The first bit is for Virtual LAN 0, the second for Virtual LAN 1, and so on. If the Virtual LAN exists in the hub the value of the associated bit is 1, otherwise 0.

scGenMonVLANTable.name: scGenMonVLANTable
scGenMonVLANTable.description: A list of virtual LAN statistics.

scGenMonVLANEntry.name: scGenMonVLANEntry
scGenMonVLANEntry.description: A list of statistics related to a specific Virtual LAN.

scGenMonVLANSwitchId.name: scGenMonVLANSwitchId
scGenMonVLANSwitchId.description: Index which identifies the XSwitch for which this entry contains information. This value is never greater than chNumberOfXSwitches.

scGenMonVLANId.name: scGenMonVLANId
scGenMonVLANId.description: The Virtual LAN for which this entry contains information.

scGenMonVLANGoodPkts.name: scGenMonVLANGoodPkts
scGenMonVLANGoodPkts.description: The total number of good packets switched by the XSwitch on this Virtual LAN.

scGenMonVLANGoodOctets.name: scGenMonVLANGoodOctets
scGenMonVLANGoodOctets.description: The total number of good octets switched by the XSwitch on this Virtual LAN.

scGenMonVLANStatsUcastPkts.name: scGenMonVLANStatsUcastPkts
scGenMonVLANStatsUcastPkts.description: The total number of good unicast packets switched by the XSwitch on this Virtual LAN.

scGenMonVLANStatsMcastPkts.name: scGenMonVLANStatsMcastPkts
scGenMonVLANStatsMcastPkts.description: The total number of good multicast packets switched by the XSwitch on this Virtual LAN.

scGenMonVLANStatsBcastPkts.name: scGenMonVLANStatsBcastPkts
scGenMonVLANStatsBcastPkts.description: The total number of good broadcast packets switched by the XSwitch on this Virtual LAN.

scGenMonSwitches.name: scGenMonSwitches
scGenMonSwitches.description: A bitmap defining the switch status, whether it is functional or not. The list should start with the MSB. Value of each bit: 0 - the switch is not functional 1 - the switch is functional The mapping is: Bit 0 : Left DomainX Bit 1 : Right DomainX

scHostTimePortCorrTable.name: scHostTimePortCorrTable
scHostTimePortCorrTable.description: An addition to the RMON MIB's hostTimeTable. This table contains a list of MAC addresses that were monitored on the switch and the ports to which they are connected. The index of this table is the same as for the standard RMON hostTimeTable. Indexes are scHostTimeCreationOrder and scHostTimeIndex. The MAC address is stored in scHostTimeAddress. The port to which the MAC address is connected is defined in scHostTimePortConnection.

scHostTimePortCorrEntry.name: scHostTimePortCorrEntry
scHostTimePortCorrEntry.description: An entry in the MAC to port correlation table.

scHostTimeAddress.name: scHostTimeAddress
scHostTimeAddress.description: The physical address of this host.

scHostTimeCreationOrder.name: scHostTimeCreationOrder
scHostTimeCreationOrder.description: An index that uniquely identifies an entry in the hostTime table among those entries associated with the same hostControlEntry. This index shall be between 1 and N, where N is the value of the associated hostControlTableSize. The ordering of the indexes is based on the order of each entry's insertion into the table, in which entries added earlier have a lower index value than entries added later. Thus the management station has the ability to learn of new entries added to this table without downloading the entire table. It is important to note that the index for a particular entry may change as an (earlier) entry is deleted from the table. Because this order may change, management stations should make use of the hostControlLastDeleteTime variable in the hostControlEntry associated with the relevant portion of the hostTimeTable. By observing this variable, the management station may detect the circumstances where a download of the table may have missed entries, and where a previous association between a value of hostTimeCreationOrder and a hostTimeEntry may no longer hold.

scHostTimeIndex.name: scHostTimeIndex
scHostTimeIndex.description: The set of collected RMON host statistics of which this entry is a part. The set of hosts identified by a particular value of this index is associated with the hostControlEntry as identified by the same value of hostControlIndex.

scHostTimePortConnection.name: scHostTimePortConnection
scHostTimePortConnection.description: The switch port to which this scHostTimeAddress is connected. The coding of the port number for Visage switches is: 32*(H-1)+P, where H is the number of the hub in the stack and P the port in the hub (1.. 32). For hosts whose port connection is not identified by the agent, the value of this item will be 65,535

scGenGroupTable.name: scGenGroupTable
scGenGroupTable.description: Table of attributes which define general configuration information about a single SC based group.

scGenGroupEntry.name: scGenGroupEntry
scGenGroupEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing data about a single Group.

scGenGroupId.name: scGenGroupId
scGenGroupId.description: Unique Id of the group in the scGenGroupTable. Equals the number of the slot by which the group is accessed.

scGenGroupUseSwitches.name: scGenGroupUseSwitches
scGenGroupUseSwitches.description: This attribute reflects the status of the `Use Switches' switch which defines the working mode of the module. on - The module works according to the switches. No Set commands may be performed on attributes related to the switches. off - Ignore Dip Switches, use stored parameters and accept all Set commands.

scGenGroupCopyPortSupport.name: scGenGroupCopyPortSupport
scGenGroupCopyPortSupport.description: Indication whether a module supports Copy-Port [on(1)], or does not support Copy-Port [off(2)].

scGenGroupXswitchConnection.name: scGenGroupXswitchConnection
scGenGroupXswitchConnection.description: This attribute identifies the Xswitch number (1..4) to which the module is connected to. In non-bridged configuration, there are potentialy up to 4 Xswitches - 1&2 for left&right Ethernet Xswitches and 3&4 for left&right TR Xswitches. In bridged configuration, there are potentialy 2 Xswitches - 1 for Ethernet Xswitch and 2 for TR Xswitch.

scGenGroupStatus.name: scGenGroupStatus
scGenGroupStatus.description: This attributes defines the status of the Xswitch module. The value 'loadsBudgetProblem' indicates that the module cannot be connected to the Xswitch because it exceeds the maximum number of loads allowed in the Xswitch.

scGenGroupSwitchType.name: scGenGroupSwitchType
scGenGroupSwitchType.description: This attribute defines the Xswitch type of the module.

scGenGroupNumberOfLoads.name: scGenGroupNumberOfLoads
scGenGroupNumberOfLoads.description: This attribute identifies the number of loads which that Xswitch module represents.

scGenGroupSetDefaults.name: scGenGroupSetDefaults
scGenGroupSetDefaults.description: Set all module and ports parameters in the XSwitch module, to their default values. This item will always return a value of off(2), since it acts like a toggle switch. Set of layer2Only(3) value, will cause partial setting, to layer2 parameters only

scGenGroupSupportCopyPortList.name: scGenGroupSupportCopyPortList
scGenGroupSupportCopyPortList.description: A bitmap defining the status of each port of the hub\module whether it support copy port or not, 0 - the port does not support copy port 1 - the port support the copy port the list should start with the MSB indicates port number 1 (one) and the LSB indicates the highest number of the ports in the hub\module. For Example: if a module\hub has 8 ports and ports number 1,3,4 support copy port while the other don't, the bitmap will be: 10110000.

scGenGroupSupportPortCountersList.name: scGenGroupSupportPortCountersList
scGenGroupSupportPortCountersList.description: A bitmap defining the status of each port of the hub\module whether it supports the port's counters, 0 - the port does not support port's counters 1 - the port support the port's counters the list should start with the MSB indicates port number 1 (one) and the LSB indicates the highest number of the ports in the hub\module. For Example: if a module\hub has 8 ports and ports number 1,3,4 support port's counters while the other don't, the bitmap will be: 10110000.

scGenGroupSupportSegCountersList.name: scGenGroupSupportSegCountersList
scGenGroupSupportSegCountersList.description: A bitmap defining the status of each port of the hub\module whether it supports the segment counters on port, 0 - the port does not support segment's counters 1 - the port support the segment's counters the list should start with the MSB indicates port number 1 (one) and the LSB indicates the highest number of the ports in the hub\module. For Example: if a module\hub has 8 ports and ports number 1,3,4 support segment's counters while the other don't, the bitmap will be: 10110000.

scGenGroupUpLinkType.name: scGenGroupUpLinkType
scGenGroupUpLinkType.description: The type of the Up Link port Relevant only for the 25th port of Visage 2500: Fiber (1) - 100BaseFX, Copper (2) -100BaseTX.

scGenGroupPlugInType.name: scGenGroupPlugInType
scGenGroupPlugInType.description: Attribute describing the type of the plug-in module

scGenGroupPlugInDescr.name: scGenGroupPlugInDescr
scGenGroupPlugInDescr.description: Descriptor of the plug-in in ASCII (readable) format, mainly for use with Generic management applications.

scGenGroupPlugInCS.name: scGenGroupPlugInCS
scGenGroupPlugInCS.description: ASCII string for description and display of the plug-in module configuration symbol. The format of the number is XXXX.YY

scGenGroupDefaultVLAN.name: scGenGroupDefaultVLAN
scGenGroupDefaultVLAN.description: Attribute describing the Default VLAN configuration on the switch ports of the module. It is determined according to scGenSwitchDefaultVLAN parameter of the agent.

scGenGroupCascadingType.name: scGenGroupCascadingType
scGenGroupCascadingType.description: Attribute describing the type of the cascding module

scGenGroupCascadingDescr.name: scGenGroupCascadingDescr
scGenGroupCascadingDescr.description: Descriptor of the cascading module in ASCII (readable) format, mainly for use with Generic management applications.

scGenGroupCascadingCS.name: scGenGroupCascadingCS
scGenGroupCascadingCS.description: ASCII string for description and display of the cascading module configuration symbol. The format of the number is XXX.YYY

scGenGroupSupportDstCopyPortList.name: scGenGroupSupportDstCopyPortList
scGenGroupSupportDstCopyPortList.description: A bitmap defining the status of each port of the hub\module whether it supports the capability of being a destination copy-port . 1 - the port has the capability of being a destination copy-port 0 - the port does not have the capability of being a destination copy-port The list should start with the MSB indicating port number 1 (one) and the LSB indicating the highest number of the ports in the hub\module. For Example: if a module\hub has 8 ports and ports number 1,3,4 can be destination copy ports, while the others cannot, then the bitmap will be: 10110000.

scGenGroupBUPSType.name: scGenGroupBUPSType
scGenGroupBUPSType.description: Attribute describing the type of the BUPS module

scGenGroupBUPSCS.name: scGenGroupBUPSCS
scGenGroupBUPSCS.description: ASCII string for description and display of the BUPS module configuration symbol. The format of the number is X.Y

scGenGroupBUPSFansStatus.name: scGenGroupBUPSFansStatus
scGenGroupBUPSFansStatus.description: The operational status of the fans included in the BUPS module: allFansOK(1) - all BUPS module's fans are operational. oneFanFailed(2) - at least one of the BUPS module's fan is failed.

scGenGroupFansStatus.name: scGenGroupFansStatus
scGenGroupFansStatus.description: The operational status of the fans included in the module: allFansOK(1) - all module's fans are operational. oneFanFailed(2) - at least one of the module's fan is failed.

scGenGroupMcFilterBoxSupport.name: scGenGroupMcFilterBoxSupport
scGenGroupMcFilterBoxSupport.description: Tells whether the box hardware supports filtering or not.

scGenGroupMcFilterPersonalitySupport.name: scGenGroupMcFilterPersonalitySupport
scGenGroupMcFilterPersonalitySupport.description: Tells whether the personality hardware supports filtering or not. The value PersonalityNotInstalld means that the a personality Extention was not installed in the specific box

scGenGroupMcFilterStackingSupport.name: scGenGroupMcFilterStackingSupport
scGenGroupMcFilterStackingSupport.description: Tells whether the stacking hardware supports filtering or not The value StackingNotInstalld means that the a stacking daughter board was not installed in the specific box

scGenGroupLACPMode.name: scGenGroupLACPMode
scGenGroupLACPMode.description: The value of this attribute determines whether LACPDU messages can be exchanged by the module's ports. If enabled, the ports will exchange LACPDU messages according to their scGenPortLACPMode MIB. If disabled, every port of the module will not exchange LACPDU messages - regardless of there scGenPortLACPMode MIB. This MIB is required for internal communication between the agent and its sub-agents, in order to distribute throughout the switch's modules the setting made on the scGenSwitchLACPMode MIB.

scGenGroupSecurityMode.name: scGenGroupSecurityMode
scGenGroupSecurityMode.description: Group intrusion security mode assigned to this module. securityMode - all ports in this module are secure according to their scGenPortSecurityMode MIB's value. nonSecurityMode - all ports in this module are not secure.

scGenGroupBroadcastStormControl.name: scGenGroupBroadcastStormControl
scGenGroupBroadcastStormControl.description: Set the Broadcast Storm Control function on all switch ports. On means that Broadcast, Multicast or Unknown packets are discarded on an ingress port, when the rate of those packets, received on the port, is above the scGenGroupBroadcastThreshold, as set by the user.

scGenGroupBroadcastThreshold.name: scGenGroupBroadcastThreshold
scGenGroupBroadcastThreshold.description: Set the Rate Threshold, in packets per second, above which Broadcast, Multicast or Unknown packets are discarded on ingress port.

scGenGroupPriorityQueuesScheduling.name: scGenGroupPriorityQueuesScheduling
scGenGroupPriorityQueuesScheduling.description: Set the Priority Queues Scheduling scheme for packets transmission from egress ports. Strict - will serve higher priority queue before lower priority queue, as long as the higher queue has packets. Weighted - will serve higher priority queue before lower priority queue, but will save specific bandwidth for each queue in order to avoid starvation of lower priority queues.

scGenGroupBoundedDelay.name: scGenGroupBoundedDelay
scGenGroupBoundedDelay.description: Set the Bounded Delay function in the switch. On will ensure that time-sensitive packets will be forwarded through the switch in no more than a maximum delay.

scGenGroupSLDAdminStatus.name: scGenGroupSLDAdminStatus
scGenGroupSLDAdminStatus.description: set the Self Loop Discovery application to enable/disable. This works with the scGenPortSLDAdminStatus

scGenGroupSmonTable.name: scGenGroupSmonTable
scGenGroupSmonTable.description: Table of smon capabilities in a single group.

scGenGroupSmonEntry.name: scGenGroupSmonEntry
scGenGroupSmonEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing data about a single Group.

scGenGroupSmonGroupId.name: scGenGroupSmonGroupId
scGenGroupSmonGroupId.description: Unique Id of the group in the scGenGroupSmonTable. Equals the number of the slot by which the group is accessed.

scGenGroupSmonCapability.name: scGenGroupSmonCapability
scGenGroupSmonCapability.description: This item is used to define which smon's application are implemented in the group. When there is a value of 0 (zero) in the relevant bit it means that the assosiated application is not supported. When there is a value of 1 (one) in the relevant bit it means that the assosiated application is supported. D0 - Statistics. D1 - History. D2 - Alarms. D3 - Host. D4 - HostTopN. D5 - Metrix. D6 - Filter. D7 - Capture. D8 - Event. D9 - TokenRing. D10 - ProtocolDir. D11 - ProtocolDist. D12 - AddressMap. D13 - NlHost. D14 - NlMatrix. D15 - AlHost. D16 - AlMatrix. D17 - UsrHistory. D18 - ProbConfig. D19 - Port. D20 - PortTopN. D21 - Subnet. D22 - SubnetMatrix. D23 - Vlan. D24 - VlanMatrix.

scGenGroupSmonVlanList.name: scGenGroupSmonVlanList
scGenGroupSmonVlanList.description: A bitmap defining the status of the virtual LANs in the Virtual LAN Table. The first bit is for Virtual LAN 0, the second for Virtual LAN 1, and so on. If the Virtual LAN exists in the hub the value of the associated bit is 1, otherwise 0.

scGenGroupSmonDropEvents.name: scGenGroupSmonDropEvents
scGenGroupSmonDropEvents.description: The total number of events ,in this group, in which the probe could not count packets due to lack of resources. This number is not necessarily the number of packets dropped; it is just the number of times this condition has been detected.

scGenGroupSmonGoodBroadcastPkts.name: scGenGroupSmonGoodBroadcastPkts
scGenGroupSmonGoodBroadcastPkts.description: The total number of good broadcast packets in this group, switched by the Xswitch.

scGenGroupSmonGoodMulticastPkts.name: scGenGroupSmonGoodMulticastPkts
scGenGroupSmonGoodMulticastPkts.description: The total number of good multicast packets, in this group, switched by the Xswitch.

scGenGroupSmonGoodPkts.name: scGenGroupSmonGoodPkts
scGenGroupSmonGoodPkts.description: The total number of good packets, in this group, switched by the Xswitch.

scGenGroupSmonBadPkts.name: scGenGroupSmonBadPkts
scGenGroupSmonBadPkts.description: The total number of bad packets , in this group, filtered by the Xswitch.

scGenGroupSmonGoodOctets.name: scGenGroupSmonGoodOctets
scGenGroupSmonGoodOctets.description: The total number of good octets, in this group, switched by the Xswitch.

scGenGroupSmonBadOctets.name: scGenGroupSmonBadOctets
scGenGroupSmonBadOctets.description: The total number of bad octets, in this group, filtered by the Xswitch.

scGenGroupSmonPkts.name: scGenGroupSmonPkts
scGenGroupSmonPkts.description: The total number of packets, good and bad, in this group, switched by the Xswitch.

scGenGroupSmonOctets.name: scGenGroupSmonOctets
scGenGroupSmonOctets.description: The total number of octets, good and bad, in this group, switched by the Xswitch.

scGenGroupSmonMIBCtrMode.name: scGenGroupSmonMIBCtrMode
scGenGroupSmonMIBCtrMode.description: This object defines for group ports to include/exclude local segment traffic in their port counters

scGenGroupVlanTable.name: scGenGroupVlanTable
scGenGroupVlanTable.description: Table of attributes which define general VLAN counters of a single SC based group.

scGenGroupVlanEntry.name: scGenGroupVlanEntry
scGenGroupVlanEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing VLAN counters in a single Group.

scGenGroupVlanGroupId.name: scGenGroupVlanGroupId
scGenGroupVlanGroupId.description: Unique Id of the group in the scGenGroupVlanTable. Equals the number of the slot by which the group is accessed.

scGenGroupVlanId.name: scGenGroupVlanId
scGenGroupVlanId.description: The Virtual LAN for which this entry contains information.

scGenGroupVlanUcastPkts.name: scGenGroupVlanUcastPkts
scGenGroupVlanUcastPkts.description: The total number of good unicast packets ,in this group, switched by the Xswitch on this Virtual LAN.

scGenGroupVlanMcastPkts.name: scGenGroupVlanMcastPkts
scGenGroupVlanMcastPkts.description: The total number of good multicast packets ,in this group, switched by the Xswitch on this Virtual LAN.

scGenGroupVlanBcastPkts.name: scGenGroupVlanBcastPkts
scGenGroupVlanBcastPkts.description: The total number of good broadcast packets in this group, switched by the Xswitch on this Virtual LAN.

scGenGroupVlanGoodPkts.name: scGenGroupVlanGoodPkts
scGenGroupVlanGoodPkts.description: The total number of good packets ,in this group, switched by the Xswitch on this Virtual LAN.

scGenGroupVlanGoodOctets.name: scGenGroupVlanGoodOctets
scGenGroupVlanGoodOctets.description: The total number of good octets ,in this group, switched by the Xswitch on this Virtual LAN.

scGenGroupVlanUcastOctets.name: scGenGroupVlanUcastOctets
scGenGroupVlanUcastOctets.description: The total number of good unicast octets ,in this group, switched by the Xswitch on this Virtual LAN.

scGenGroupVlanMcastOctets.name: scGenGroupVlanMcastOctets
scGenGroupVlanMcastOctets.description: The total number of good multicast octets ,in this group, switched by the Xswitch on this Virtual LAN.

scGenGroupVlanBcastOctets.name: scGenGroupVlanBcastOctets
scGenGroupVlanBcastOctets.description: The total number of good broadcast octets ,in this group, switched by the Xswitch on this Virtual LAN.

scGenGroupVlanCurrentEgressPorts.name: scGenGroupVlanCurrentEgressPorts
scGenGroupVlanCurrentEgressPorts.description: The set of ports in this module which are transmitting traffic for this vlan as either tagged or untagged frames. Each module's port is represented by a single bit in this 128-bits bitmap according to the PortList convention of RFC2674. This MIB is for internal agent sub-agent communication, it is aimed to distribute the standard dot1qVlanCurrentEgressPorts among the modules.

scGenGroupVlanCurrentUntaggedPorts.name: scGenGroupVlanCurrentUntaggedPorts
scGenGroupVlanCurrentUntaggedPorts.description: The set of ports which are transmitting traffic for this VLAN as untagged frames. Each module's port is represented by a single bit in this 128-bits bitmap according to the PortList convention of RFC2674. This MIB is for internal agent sub-agent communication, it is aimed to distribute the standard dot1qVlanCurrentUntaggedPorts among the modules. It is updated together with genPortVLANMode MIB.

scGenGroupVlanStaticEgressPorts.name: scGenGroupVlanStaticEgressPorts
scGenGroupVlanStaticEgressPorts.description: The set of ports in this module which are permanently assigned to the egress list for this VLAN by management. Each module's port is represented by a single bit in this 128-bits bitmap according to the PortList convention of RFC2674. Changes to a bit in this object affect the per-port per-VLAN Registrar control for Registration Fixed for the relevant GVRP state machine on each port. The default value of this object is a string of zeros long by 128 bits, indicating not fixed. This MIB is for internal agent sub-agent communication, it is aimed to distribute the standard dot1qVlanStaticEgressPorts among the modules.

scGenGroupVlanStaticUntaggedPorts.name: scGenGroupVlanStaticUntaggedPorts
scGenGroupVlanStaticUntaggedPorts.description: The set of ports which should transmit egress packets for this VLAN as untagged. Each module's port is represented by a single bit in this 128-bits bitmap according to the PortList convention of RFC2674. The default value of this object for the default VLAN (dot1qVlanIndex = 1) is a string of appropriate length including all ports. There is no specified default for other VLANs. If a device agent cannot support the set of ports being set then it will reject the set operation with an error. An example might be if a manager attempts to set more than one VLAN to be untagged on egress where the device does not support this IEEE 802.1Q option. It is updated together with genPortVLANMode MIB.

scGenGroupRspGroupId.name: scGenGroupRspGroupId
scGenGroupRspGroupId.description: Unique Id of the group in the scGenGroupRspTable. Equals the number of the slot by which the group is accessed.

scGenGroupRspHelloInterval.name: scGenGroupRspHelloInterval
scGenGroupRspHelloInterval.description: The interval between transmissions of hello-messages, in 100mSec units.

scGenGroupRspDevicePollingInterval.name: scGenGroupRspDevicePollingInterval
scGenGroupRspDevicePollingInterval.description: The interval between transmissions of ARP queries for polling connectivity to the device, in 100mSec units.

scGenGroupRspDeviceNotRespondingTimeout.name: scGenGroupRspDeviceNotRespondingTimeout
scGenGroupRspDeviceNotRespondingTimeout.description: Amount of time in which no ARP-replies are received from the device, which cause the RSP to assume no connection to that device, in 100mSec units.

scGenGroupRspSwitchNotRespondingTimeout.name: scGenGroupRspSwitchNotRespondingTimeout
scGenGroupRspSwitchNotRespondingTimeout.description: Amount of time in which no hello-messages with acknowledge are received from the other switch, which cause the RSP to assume no connection to that switch, in 100mSec units.

scGenGroupRspMoveToForwardingInterval.name: scGenGroupRspMoveToForwardingInterval
scGenGroupRspMoveToForwardingInterval.description: Amount of time the port waits upon deciding to move to forwarding mode, until it moves to that mode, in 100mSec units.

scGenGroupRspBroadcastArpShortInterval.name: scGenGroupRspBroadcastArpShortInterval
scGenGroupRspBroadcastArpShortInterval.description: The interval in which the switch should send broadcast ARPs to the device when not knowing the MAC-address of the device, in 100mSec units.

scGenGroupRspBroadcastArpShortIntervalNu.name: scGenGroupRspBroadcastArpShortIntervalNumber
scGenGroupRspBroadcastArpShortIntervalNu.description: The number of broadcast ARPs the switch should send in short interval time, when not knowing the MAC address of the device

scGenGroupRspBroadcastArpLongInterval.name: scGenGroupRspBroadcastArpLongInterval
scGenGroupRspBroadcastArpLongInterval.description: The interval in which the switch should send broadcast ARPs to the device when the device does not respond to unicast ARPs, in 100mSec units.

scGenGroupRspPeriodicPingsBoxIpAddress.name: scGenGroupRspPeriodicPingsBoxIpAddress
scGenGroupRspPeriodicPingsBoxIpAddress.description: This MIB-item is the IP-address that the P330 box uses in order to periodically ping to devices Default value for IP Address is 0.0.0.0

scGenGroupRspPeriodicPingsDestinationIpA.name: scGenGroupRspPeriodicPingsDestinationIpAddress
scGenGroupRspPeriodicPingsDestinationIpA.description: This MIB-item sets an IpAddress that the devices will be configured to periodically ping to. The switch will be responsible to reply to ARP-queries concerning this IP-address, and which were issued by devices directly attached to it. A value of 0.0.0.0 in this Mib Item means that it does not describe an existing IpAddress. Default value for IP Address is 0.0.0.0

scGenGroupRspMode.name: scGenGroupRspMode
scGenGroupRspMode.description: Sets the mode of the module from the RSP-application prespective. Possible modes are: RSP-module-mode-role-A - means that the ports of this module perform the RSP scheme for a device connected through a repeater, in role A (primary role). RSP-module-mode-role-B - means that the ports of this module perform the RSP scheme for a device connected through a repeater, in role B (secondary role).

scGenPortTable.name: scGenPortTable
scGenPortTable.description: Table of attributes which define general configuration information about a single SC based port.

scGenPortEntry.name: scGenPortEntry
scGenPortEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing data about a single Port.

scGenPortGroupId.name: scGenPortGroupId
scGenPortGroupId.description: Id of the group to which the port belongs.

scGenPortId.name: scGenPortId
scGenPortId.description: Unique Id of the port in the scEthPortTable.

scGenPortVLAN.name: scGenPortVLAN
scGenPortVLAN.description: The Virtual LAN number of the Port. The value 0 means Generic ( But can communicate with Global !). The value '255' means Global.

scGenPortPriority.name: scGenPortPriority
scGenPortPriority.description: The priority level of the packets send by the Port.

scGenPortSetDefaults.name: scGenPortSetDefaults
scGenPortSetDefaults.description: Set all port parameters in the XSwitch module, to their default values. This item is used for ports that are managed by Sub-agents. This item will always return a value of off(2), since it acts like a toggle switch.

scGenPortBackbone.name: scGenPortBackbone
scGenPortBackbone.description: The type of the Xswitch port. 'on' indicates that the port was discovered by VIDP as backbone port.

scGenPortCopyMode.name: scGenPortCopyMode
scGenPortCopyMode.description: Enable /Disable the Copy Port mode in the Sub-Agent.

scGenPortCopyDestination.name: scGenPortCopyDestination
scGenPortCopyDestination.description: The destination of the copied information. The destination can be another port or the Agent acting as an RMON probe. The value of this item is: LSB Byte= sniffer channel number, Next Byte= sniffer device number. When sniffer device number=31, the destination is the Agent.

scGenPortLinkAggregationNumber.name: scGenPortLinkAggregationNumber
scGenPortLinkAggregationNumber.description: The Link Aggregation Group (LAG) number, to which the Port belongs. The value 0 means that this port is not part of a LAG. This is also the default.

scGenPortSendBridgedPackets.name: scGenPortSendBridgedPackets
scGenPortSendBridgedPackets.description: When set to on(1), the port will transmit to the line bridged frames (for which their secondary VLAN was 0xFFE internally). This is the case for ports connected to a station or to another switch that has no bridging capabilities. When set to off(2), the port will reject the bridged frames, by not sending them to the line. This is the case for ports connected to another switch that has its own bridging capabilities. Default value is on(1).

scGenPortVLANEgressStaticConfiguration.name: scGenPortVLANEgressStaticConfiguration
scGenPortVLANEgressStaticConfiguration.description: A bitmap defining the VLANs, for which the port is member in their Egress Tables. The first bit is for VLAN 0, the second bit for VLAN 1, and so on. If the port is member in the Egress Table of a specified VLAN, then the value of the associated bit is 1, otherwise 0. The actual VLAN Table configuration, according to this item, is done only when scGenPortStaticVLANBinding is enabled.

scGenPortStaticVLANBinding.name: scGenPortStaticVLANBinding
scGenPortStaticVLANBinding.description: This object defines whether Static VLAN Binding is enabled or disabled on the port. If enabled, the port is member in the Egress List of the VLANs, as specified in scGenPortVLANEgressStaticConfiguration, in addition to its Port VLAN. If disabled, the port is member in the Egress List of the VLANs, according to the VLAN Tagging mode of the port - i.e. if VLAN Tagging mode is Clear, then the Port is member in the Egress List of only the Port VLAN. If VLAN Tagging mode is 802.1Qtagging, then the Port is member in the Egress List of all VLANs.

scGenPortSecId.name: scGenPortSecId
scGenPortSecId.description: The identification number (per module) of the switching chip to which the port belongs.

scGenPortMaxLagsOnSec.name: scGenPortMaxLagsOnSec
scGenPortMaxLagsOnSec.description: The theoretic maximum number of LAGs that can be defined over the switching chip to which the port belongs. The value is fixed according to the switching chip type: For the Timpani chip, the value is 1. For the Guitar chip, the value is 2.

scGenPortGenericTrap.name: scGenPortGenericTrap
scGenPortGenericTrap.description: The value of this attribute determines whether or not the agent sends the snmp generic traps 2 and 3, for link down/up events on this port.

scGenPortLACPMode.name: scGenPortLACPMode
scGenPortLACPMode.description: The value of this attribute determines whether the port exchanges LACPDU messages, in agreement with the scGenGroupLACPMode MIB.

scGenPortLastIntruderSourceAddr.name: scGenPortLastIntruderSourceAddr
scGenPortLastIntruderSourceAddr.description: Ethernet source address of the last intrusion attempt at this port. The value of this item will be 000000 (a string of 6 zeros) if security mode is disable or no security violation at this port.

scGenPortSecurityMode.name: scGenPortSecurityMode
scGenPortSecurityMode.description: Security mode assigned to this port. nonSecurityMode - do not perform intrusion control security mechanism on this port. securityMode - perform intrusion control security mechanism and trap the console in case of security violation, if both scGenGroupSecurityMode and scGenSwitchSecurityMode are in this mode too.

scGenPortSTA.name: scGenPortSTA
scGenPortSTA.description: Enable /Disable the Spanning Tree protocol for this port, meaningless when disabled at the switch level via the scGenSwitchSTA MIB.

scGenPortLagCapability.name: scGenPortLagCapability
scGenPortLagCapability.description: An octet string with the size of the maximum number of LAGs on the device. Each bit represents a LAG which the port may be associated with (a member of).

scGenPortCapability.name: scGenPortCapability
scGenPortCapability.description: Port capability bit mask, where each bit represent the capability of the port: Bit #1 - 10Mbps speed support Bit #2 - 100Mbps speed support Bit #3 - 1000Mbps speed support Bit #4 - 10000Mbps speed support Bit #9 - 2 queues support Bit #10 - 4 queues support Bit #11 - 8 queue support Bit #17 - CopyPort Tx support Bit #18 - CopyPort Rx support Bit #19 - CopyPort Tx&Rx support Bit #20 - CopyPort filtering support Bit #25 - Symmetric FC support Bit #26 - AsymmetricTx FC support Bit #27 - AsymmetricRx FC support

scGenPortSLDAdminStatus.name: scGenPortSLDAdminStatus
scGenPortSLDAdminStatus.description: Sets the admin status of each port in the Self Loop Discovery application A port which is disbaled does not send LDDU . A port which is enabled sends LDDU and migth turn to blocking if a SLD is discovered.

scGenPortSLDStatus.name: scGenPortSLDStatus
scGenPortSLDStatus.description: A port which is SLDEnabled can be in SelfLoop or NoSelfLoop mode . if the port is SLD disabled it will return notSupported.

scGenPortRspTable.name: scGenPortRspTable
scGenPortRspTable.description: Table of attributes which define general configuration information about a single SC based port.

scGenPortRspEntry.name: scGenPortRspEntry
scGenPortRspEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing data about a single Port.

scGenPortRspGroupId.name: scGenPortRspGroupId
scGenPortRspGroupId.description: Id of the group to which the port belongs.

scGenPortRspId.name: scGenPortRspId
scGenPortRspId.description: Unique Id of the port in the scGenPortRspTable.

scGenPortRspMode.name: scGenPortRspMode
scGenPortRspMode.description: Sets the mode of the port from the RSP-application perspective. Possible modes are: Regular - means that this is a regular port that does not participate in the RSP scheme, RSP-mode-role-A - means that this port performs the RSP scheme for a device connected through a repeater, in role A (primary role). RSP-mode-role-B - means that this port performs the RSP scheme for a device connected through a repeater, in role B (secondary role). device-mode - means that this port performs the RSP scheme for a device with two interfaces.

scGenSwitchTable.name: scGenSwitchTable
scGenSwitchTable.description: Table of attributes which define information about a single XSwitch in SC based devices.

scGenSwitchEntry.name: scGenSwitchEntry
scGenSwitchEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing data about a single XSwitch.

scGenSwitchId.name: scGenSwitchId
scGenSwitchId.description: Index which identifies the XSwitch for which this entry contains information. This value is never greater than chNumberOfXSwitches.

scGenSwitchCopyMode.name: scGenSwitchCopyMode
scGenSwitchCopyMode.description: Enable /Disable the Copy Port mode in the XSwitch.

scGenSwitchCopySource.name: scGenSwitchCopySource
scGenSwitchCopySource.description: The port in the switch that is being copied. All received and transmit packets on the port( including local traffic ) are copied to the defined destination, besides their normal destination. The value of this item is: 1024*S+P, where S is the slot number in the hub and P the port within the slot.

scGenSwitchCopyDestination.name: scGenSwitchCopyDestination
scGenSwitchCopyDestination.description: The destination of the copied information. The destination can be another port or the Agent acting as an RMON probe. The value of this item is: 1024*S+P, where S is the slot number in the hub and P is the port within the slot. Value 1023 means that the destination is the Agent.

scGenSwitchSetDefaults.name: scGenSwitchSetDefaults
scGenSwitchSetDefaults.description: Set all port parameters in the XSwitch, to their default values. This item will always return a value of off(2), since it acts like a toggle switch.

scGenSwitchVIDP.name: scGenSwitchVIDP
scGenSwitchVIDP.description: Enable /Disable the VIDP protocol supported in the XSwitch.

scGenSwitchType.name: scGenSwitchType
scGenSwitchType.description: This attribute defines the type of the Xswitch.

scGenSwitchMasterId.name: scGenSwitchMasterId
scGenSwitchMasterId.description: This attribute defines which module in the Xswitch take the role of the Master. It is equal to the slot number of the Xswitch Master.

scGenSwitchReset.name: scGenSwitchReset
scGenSwitchReset.description: Setting this attribute to `on' will cause a reset to the Xswitch. Default value is 'off'.

scGenSwitchNumberOfLoads.name: scGenSwitchNumberOfLoads
scGenSwitchNumberOfLoads.description: This attribute identifies the total number of loads of that Xswitch. There is a maximum budget of 30 loads on an single Xswitch.

scGenSwitchAgVLAN.name: scGenSwitchAgVLAN
scGenSwitchAgVLAN.description: The Virtual LAN number of the Agent's internal interface in the switch. The value 0 means Generic (But can communicate with Global !). The value '255' means Global.

scGenSwitchVLANList.name: scGenSwitchVLANList
scGenSwitchVLANList.description: A bitmap defining the status of the virtual LANs in the Virtual LAN Table. The first bit is for Virtual LAN 0, the second for Virtual LAN 1, and so on. If the Virtual LAN exists in the hub the value of the associated bit is 1, otherwise 0.

scGenSwitchSTA.name: scGenSwitchSTA
scGenSwitchSTA.description: Enable /Disable the Spanning Tree protocol support in the switch.

scGenSwitchSecurityMode.name: scGenSwitchSecurityMode
scGenSwitchSecurityMode.description: This item defines the Security mode per stack. nonSecurityMode - all ports in the stack are not secure. securityMode - all ports in the stack are secure according to their scGenPortSecurityMode MIB's value.

scGenSwitchFindQuery.name: scGenSwitchFindQuery
scGenSwitchFindQuery.description: An address to be searched for by the Agent. The Agent will start look for the address when the value is different than Null. The string format is: 1st byte: address type - 0=MAC, 1=IP Next bytes: the address. (for MAC: next 6 bytes, for IP: next 4 bytes).

scGenSwitchFindResult.name: scGenSwitchFindResult
scGenSwitchFindResult.description: The search result. The result string format is: 1st byte: address type - 0=MAC, 1=IP. Next bytes: the address. (for MAC: next 6 bytes, for IP: next 4 bytes) 7-th byte (for MAC) or 5-th byte (for IP): number of ports with the specified address. Every next two bytes will indicate the slot and port number. 8-th byte (for MAC) or 6-th byte (for IP): slot number. 9-th byte (for MAC) or 7-th byte (for IP): port number. Etc. If the specified address was NOT found, the result will be with the 7-th byte (for MAC) or 5-th byte (for IP): byte equal to _0_.

scGenSwitchSWRdChange.name: scGenSwitchSWRdChange
scGenSwitchSWRdChange.description: A 4-byte octet-string indicating a change performed by the SW Redundancy task. The string will include: Byte 1: Group1 (module number). Byte 2 : Port1 Byte 3 : Group2 Byte 4 : port2 Where group2 port2 are the new enabled port.

scGenSwitchDefaultVLAN.name: scGenSwitchDefaultVLAN
scGenSwitchDefaultVLAN.description: Attribute describing the Default VLAN configuration on the switch ports. The user may change the value of this parameter through the setup terminal. Vlan1 is the standard default VLAN for port configuration.

scGenSwitchVLANBridging.name: scGenSwitchVLANBridging
scGenSwitchVLANBridging.description: VLAN Bridging mode should be enabled in all Xswitches in the network, when the user wants to support network-wide VLAN Bridging. VLAN Bridging should also be enabled in one M-MLS, and PLS-Tagging mode should be set on the backbone ports.

scGenSwitchOldVersionModules.name: scGenSwitchOldVersionModules
scGenSwitchOldVersionModules.description: A list of modules, in ASCII format, that have older software versions than necessary in the switch. Module numbers are separated by a comma and a space. It is used to inform the user on version inconsistency.

scGenSwitchVIDPNonSupportedModules.name: scGenSwitchVIDPNonSupportedModules
scGenSwitchVIDPNonSupportedModules.description: A list of modules, in ASCII format, that do not support the VIDP function. Module numbers are separated by a comma and a space. It is used to inform the user on possible problems in VIDP function, as not all modules in the switch support VIDP.

scGenSwitchSTANonSupportedModules.name: scGenSwitchSTANonSupportedModules
scGenSwitchSTANonSupportedModules.description: A list of modules, in ASCII format, that do not support the STA function. Module numbers are separated by a comma and a space. It is used to inform the user on possible problems in STA function, as not all modules in the switch support STA.

scGenSwitchIDSNonSupportedModules.name: scGenSwitchIDSNonSupportedModules
scGenSwitchIDSNonSupportedModules.description: A list of modules, in ASCII format, that do not support the IDS function. Module numbers are separated by a comma and a space. It is used to inform the user on possible problems in IDS function, as not all modules in the switch support IDS.

scGenSwitchMcFilter.name: scGenSwitchMcFilter
scGenSwitchMcFilter.description: Enable/disable the multicast filtering mechanism supported in the switch

scGenSwitchMcFilterHostAgingTime.name: scGenSwitchMcFilterHostAgingTime
scGenSwitchMcFilterHostAgingTime.description: The Value of the Host-Aging-Time parameter used by the multicast filtering mechanism for aging learned multicast filtering information

scGenSwitchMcFilterRouterAgingTime.name: scGenSwitchMcFilterRouterAgingTime
scGenSwitchMcFilterRouterAgingTime.description: The Value of the Router-Aging-Time parameter used by the multicast filtering mechanism for aging learned router-ports information

scGenSwitchMcFilterDelayTime.name: scGenSwitchMcFilterDelayTime
scGenSwitchMcFilterDelayTime.description: The Value of the Delay-Time parameter used by the multicast filtering mechanism for waiting to all registration requests before applying a filter on a specific group

scGenSwitchLACPMode.name: scGenSwitchLACPMode
scGenSwitchLACPMode.description: The value of this attribute determines whether LACPDU messages can be exchanged by the switch's ports. If enabled, the ports will exchange LACPDU messages according to their scGenPortLACPMode MIB. If disabled, every port of the switch will not exchange LACPDU messages - regardless of their scGenPortLACPMode MIB.

scGenSwitchSecurityModePermit.name: scGenSwitchSecurityModePermit
scGenSwitchSecurityModePermit.description: This item defines the Security mode per switch. This MIB is encoded in Lucent specific security mechanism.

scGenSwitchFastAgingOnRemoteTopChg.name: scGenSwitchFastAgingOnRemoteTopChg
scGenSwitchFastAgingOnRemoteTopChg.description: This item defines if the switch performs fast aging on the MAC address forwarding database (or reset the cam contents) upon reception of Topology Change BPDU from the STA root, indicating that a remote topology change has occurred. Local topology changes that occur on valuable ports always generate a fast aging anyway.

scGenSwitchGigaMode.name: scGenSwitchGigaMode
scGenSwitchGigaMode.description: The value of this attribute determines the setting for the two Giga links of a P130 stack.

scGenSwitchCAMClear.name: scGenSwitchCAMClear
scGenSwitchCAMClear.description: When value sets to on(1), the switch clears its CAM table. This item will always return a value of off(2), since it acts like a toggle switch.

scGenLinkAggregationTable.name: scGenLinkAggregationTable
scGenLinkAggregationTable.description: Table of attributes which define Link Aggregation Group in a single switch.

scGenLinkAggregationEntry.name: scGenLinkAggregationEntry
scGenLinkAggregationEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing LAG information in a single switch.

scGenLinkAggregationId.name: scGenLinkAggregationId
scGenLinkAggregationId.description: The Link Aggregation number for which this entry contains information.

scGenLinkAggregationName.name: scGenLinkAggregationName
scGenLinkAggregationName.description: The Link Aggregation name, given by the user.

scGenLinkAggregationBasePortGroupId.name: scGenLinkAggregationBasePortGroupId
scGenLinkAggregationBasePortGroupId.description: The slot/unit number of the Base Port for this Link Aggregation.

scGenLinkAggregationBasePortId.name: scGenLinkAggregationBasePortId
scGenLinkAggregationBasePortId.description: The port number in the slot/unit of the Base Port for this Link Aggregation.

scGenLinkAggregationNumberOfPorts.name: scGenLinkAggregationNumberOfPorts
scGenLinkAggregationNumberOfPorts.description: The current number of ports that belong to this Link Aggregation.

scGenLinkAggregationLogicalPortGroupId.name: scGenLinkAggregationLogicalPortGroupId
scGenLinkAggregationLogicalPortGroupId.description: The slot number of the logical port, representing this Link Aggregation. All parameters for the LAG are managed through that logical port.

scGenLinkAggregationLogicalPortId.name: scGenLinkAggregationLogicalPortId
scGenLinkAggregationLogicalPortId.description: The logical port number in the slot, representing this Link Aggregation. All parameters for the LAG are managed through that logical port.

scGenLinkAggregationFunctionalStatus.name: scGenLinkAggregationFunctionalStatus
scGenLinkAggregationFunctionalStatus.description: The functional status of the LAG: ok(1) - fully functional LAG, transmitting and receiving packets on all its ports. fail(2) - all ports in the LAG are not in ok status. partialFail(3) - some of the ports in the LAG are not in ok status.

scGenLinkAggregationAutoNegResults.name: scGenLinkAggregationAutoNegResults
scGenLinkAggregationAutoNegResults.description: The auto-negotiation results for speed and duplex for the LAG ports: ok(1) - all ports resolved the same speed and duplex mode after auto-negotiation process. autoNegInconsistantResults(2) - not all ports resolved the same speed and duplex mode after auto-negotiation process.

scGenLinkAggregationFaultMask.name: scGenLinkAggregationFaultMask
scGenLinkAggregationFaultMask.description: Each bit of this item describes the situation of the LAG regarding specific fault: bit 1: on indicates 'LAG connection lost' when scGenLinkAggregationFunctionalStatus=fail(2) bit 2: on indicates 'LAG partial connection' when scGenLinkAggregationFunctionalStatus=partailFail(3) bit 3: on indicates 'LAG auto-neg inconsistant results' when scGenLinkAggregationAutoNegResults= autoNegInconsistantResults(2)

scGenLinkAggregationStatus.name: scGenLinkAggregationStatus
scGenLinkAggregationStatus.description: The status of this scGenLinkAggregation entry. According to RMON-2 standard (RFC 2021).

scGenPortIPAddressRspTable.name: scGenPortIPAddressRspTable
scGenPortIPAddressRspTable.description: Table of attributes which define general configuration information about a single SC based port.

scGenPortIPAddressRspEntry.name: scGenPortIPAddressRspEntry
scGenPortIPAddressRspEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing data about a single Port.

scGenPortIPAddressRspGroupId.name: scGenPortIPAddressRspGroupId
scGenPortIPAddressRspGroupId.description: Id of the group to which the port belongs.

scGenPortIPAddressRspPortId.name: scGenPortIPAddressRspPortId
scGenPortIPAddressRspPortId.description: Unique Id of the port in the scGenPortRspTable.

scGenPortIPAddressRspIpAddressIndex.name: scGenPortIPAddressRspIpAddressIndex
scGenPortIPAddressRspIpAddressIndex.description: Unique Id of the port in the scGenPortRspTable.

scGenPortIPAddressRspIpAddress.name: scGenPortIPAddressRspIpAddress
scGenPortIPAddressRspIpAddress.description: This MIB-item sets an IpAddress of a station that is connected to a port that performs RSP. A value of 0.0.0.0 in this Mib Item means that it does not describe an existing IpAddress. Default value is 0.0.0.0

scEthPortTable.name: scEthPortTable
scEthPortTable.description: Table of attributes which define configuration, performance and error information about ethernet ports based on the switchChip.

scEthPortEntry.name: scEthPortEntry
scEthPortEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing data about a single port.

scEthPortGroupId.name: scEthPortGroupId
scEthPortGroupId.description: Id of the group to which the port belongs.

scEthPortId.name: scEthPortId
scEthPortId.description: Unique Id of the port in the scEthPortTable.

scEthPortOctetsRec.name: scEthPortOctetsRec
scEthPortOctetsRec.description: The total number of good octets received and bad octets filtered by the port (excluding framing bits but including FCS octets). This item is the summation of scEthPortGoodOctetsRec and scEthPortBadOctets.

scEthPortPktsRec.name: scEthPortPktsRec
scEthPortPktsRec.description: The total number of good packets received and bad packets filtered by the port. This item is the summation of scEthPortGoodPktsRec and scEthPortBadPkts.

scEthPortGoodBroadcastPktsRec.name: scEthPortGoodBroadcastPktsRec
scEthPortGoodBroadcastPktsRec.description: The total number of good packets received that were directed to the broadcast address.

scEthPortGoodMulticastPktsRec.name: scEthPortGoodMulticastPktsRec
scEthPortGoodMulticastPktsRec.description: The total number of good packets received that were directed to a multicast address. Note that this number does not include packets directed to the broadcast address.

scEthPortCRCAlignErrors.name: scEthPortCRCAlignErrors
scEthPortCRCAlignErrors.description: The total number of packets received that had a length (excluding framing bits, but including FCS octets) of between 64 and 1518 octets, inclusive, but were not an integral number of octets in length or had a bad Frame Check Sequence (FCS).

scEthPortOversizePkts.name: scEthPortOversizePkts
scEthPortOversizePkts.description: The total number of packets received that were longer than 1518 octets (excluding framing bits, but including FCS octets) and were otherwise well formed.

scEthPortFragments.name: scEthPortFragments
scEthPortFragments.description: The total number of packets received that were less than 64 octets in length (excluding framing bits but including FCS octets).

scEthPortJabber.name: scEthPortJabber
scEthPortJabber.description: The total number of packets received that were longer than 1518 octets (excluding framing bits, but including FCS octets), and were not an integral number of octets in length or had a bad Frame Check Sequence (FCS).

scEthPortCollisions.name: scEthPortCollisions
scEthPortCollisions.description: The best estimate of the total number of collisions on this Ethernet segment.

scEthPortPkts64Octets.name: scEthPortPkts64Octets
scEthPortPkts64Octets.description: The total number of packets (including error packets) that were 64 octets in length (excluding framing bits but including FCS octets).

scEthPortPkts65to127Octets.name: scEthPortPkts65to127Octets
scEthPortPkts65to127Octets.description: The total number of packets (including error packets) that were between 65 and 127 octets in length inclusive (excluding framing bits but including FCS octets).

scEthPortPkts128to255Octets.name: scEthPortPkts128to255Octets
scEthPortPkts128to255Octets.description: The total number of packets (including error packets) that were between 128 and 255 octets in length inclusive (excluding framing bits but including FCS octets).

scEthPortPkts256to511Octets.name: scEthPortPkts256to511Octets
scEthPortPkts256to511Octets.description: The total number of packets (including error packets) that were between 256 and 511 octets in length inclusive (excluding framing bits but including FCS octets).

scEthPortPkts512to1023Octets.name: scEthPortPkts512to1023Octets
scEthPortPkts512to1023Octets.description: The total number of packets (including error packets) that were between 512 and 1023 octets in length inclusive (excluding framing bits but including FCS octets).

scEthPortPkts1024to1518Octets.name: scEthPortPkts1024to1518Octets
scEthPortPkts1024to1518Octets.description: The total number of packets (including error packets) that were between 1024 and 1518 octets in length inclusive (excluding framing bits but including FCS octets).

scEthPortGoodPktsRec.name: scEthPortGoodPktsRec
scEthPortGoodPktsRec.description: The total number of good packets received by the port.

scEthPortBadPkts.name: scEthPortBadPkts
scEthPortBadPkts.description: The total number of bad packets filtered by the port. This item is the summation of: scEthPortCRCAlignErrors, scEthPortOversizePkts, scEthPortFragments and scEthPortJabber.

scEthPortGoodOctetsRec.name: scEthPortGoodOctetsRec
scEthPortGoodOctetsRec.description: The total number of good octets of data received by the port.

scEthPortBadOctets.name: scEthPortBadOctets
scEthPortBadOctets.description: The total number of bad octets of data filtered by the port.

scEthPortGoodBroadcastOctetsRec.name: scEthPortGoodBroadcastOctetsRec
scEthPortGoodBroadcastOctetsRec.description: The total number of good octets received that were directed to the broadcast address.

scEthPortGoodMulticastOctetsRec.name: scEthPortGoodMulticastOctetsRec
scEthPortGoodMulticastOctetsRec.description: The total number of good octets received that were directed to a multicast address. Note that this number does not include octets directed to the broadcast address.

scEthPortGoodOctetsSent.name: scEthPortGoodOctetsSent
scEthPortGoodOctetsSent.description: The total number of good octets of data sent by the port.

scEthPortGoodPktsSent.name: scEthPortGoodPktsSent
scEthPortGoodPktsSent.description: The total number of good packets sent by the port.

scEthPortLateCollisions.name: scEthPortLateCollisions
scEthPortLateCollisions.description: The best estimate of the total number of late collisions on this Ethernet segment.

scEthPortFunctionalStatus.name: scEthPortFunctionalStatus
scEthPortFunctionalStatus.description: The functional status of the port: ok(1) - fully functional port, transmitting and receiving packets. rld(2) - receive link down condition on the port - Indicates a cable or connector failure detected by the port H/W. partition(8) - the port is in partition state.

scEthPortMode.name: scEthPortMode
scEthPortMode.description: The flow control mode of the port when operated in full duplex: halfDuplex(1) - Half duplex connection, standard mode for segment fullDuplexNoPause(2) - Full duplex connection without exchanging flow control packets fullDuplexProprietaryFC(3) - Full duplex connection with Lucent's proprietary flow control frames exchanged fullDuplexISL(4) - Full duplex connection with ISL proprietary protocol control words for VLAN & priority exchanged, ISL = Inter-Switch-Link fullDuplexFlowControlISL(5) - Full duplex connection with both ISL proprietary protocol control words and flow control frames exchanged fullDuplexAsymTxPause(6) - Full duplex connection with STD 802.3x flow control frames sent from this port, but flow control packets received on it are not processed fullDuplexSymPause(7) - Full duplex connection with STD 802.3x flow control frames exchanged fullDuplexAsymRxPause(8) - Full duplex connection with no flow control frames sent from this port, but STD 802.3x flow control 0frames received on it are processed. For Giga ports, when auto-negotiation is enabled, the flow control mode is set internally according to auto-negotiation resolution; and access to this item is read-only.

scEthPortSpeed.name: scEthPortSpeed
scEthPortSpeed.description: This parameter defines the port speed: ethernet(1) and fastEthernet(2).

scEthPortAutoNegotiation.name: scEthPortAutoNegotiation
scEthPortAutoNegotiation.description: This object define if the Auto Sense /Auto Negotiation process is enable(1) or disable (2) for modules that don't support the Auto Snese mode please define the notSupported option..

scEthPortAutoNegotiationStatus.name: scEthPortAutoNegotiationStatus
scEthPortAutoNegotiationStatus.description: This object define the status of the Auto Negotiation process: pass: The Auto negotiation process was completed and succeeded . fail: The Auto Negotiation process failed . disable: The Auto Negotiation process is not enabled . notSupported: The Auto Negotiation feature is not available in this module .

scEthPortTotalOctets.name: scEthPortTotalOctets
scEthPortTotalOctets.description: The total number of octets received and transmitted on the port (including all good and bad). This item is the summation of scEthPortOctetsRec and scEthPortGoodOctetsSent.

scEthPortTotalPkts.name: scEthPortTotalPkts
scEthPortTotalPkts.description: The total number of packets received and transmitted on the port (including all good and bad). This item is the summation of scEthPortPktsRec and scEthPortGoodPktsSent.

scEthPortDropEvents.name: scEthPortDropEvents
scEthPortDropEvents.description: The total number of events in which the probe could not count packets due to lack of resources. This number is not necessarily the number of packets dropped; it is just the number of times this condition has been detected.

scEthPortGigaPauseStatus.name: scEthPortGigaPauseStatus
scEthPortGigaPauseStatus.description: Indicates the status of the Flow Control as determined in the Auto Negotiation process on the Gigabit ports: noPause(1) indicates that there is no Flow Control. symmetricPause(2) indicates that both sides are working in Tx&Rx Flow Control. asymmetricPauseRx(3) indicates that both sides agreed on working in asynnetric Flow Control - TxOnly against RxOnly. If Giga Auto Neg is disabled, then noPause(1) is indicated when Flow Control is disabled, while symmetricPause(2) is indicated when Flow Control is enabled.

scEthPortLower32OctetsRec.name: scEthPortLower32OctetsRec
scEthPortLower32OctetsRec.description: Lower 32 bit conter of the total number of octets of data received by the port.

scEthPortUpper32OctetsRec.name: scEthPortUpper32OctetsRec
scEthPortUpper32OctetsRec.description: Upper 32 bit conter of the total number of octets of data received by the port.

scEthPortLower32OctetsSent.name: scEthPortLower32OctetsSent
scEthPortLower32OctetsSent.description: Lower 32 bit conter of the total number of octets of data sent by the port.

scEthPortUpper32OctetsSent.name: scEthPortUpper32OctetsSent
scEthPortUpper32OctetsSent.description: Upper 32 bit conter of the total number of octets of data sent by the port.

scEthPortGoodUnicastPktsRec.name: scEthPortGoodUnicastPktsRec
scEthPortGoodUnicastPktsRec.description: The total number of good packets received that were directed to a unicast address.

scEthPortDiscardPktsRec.name: scEthPortDiscardPktsRec
scEthPortDiscardPktsRec.description: The total number of packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

scEthPortUnicastPktsSent.name: scEthPortUnicastPktsSent
scEthPortUnicastPktsSent.description: The total number of good packets sent by the port that were directed to a unicast address.

scEthPortDiscardPktsSent.name: scEthPortDiscardPktsSent
scEthPortDiscardPktsSent.description: The total number of packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

scEthPortPauseCapabilities.name: scEthPortPauseCapabilities
scEthPortPauseCapabilities.description: The Pause capabilities of a Giga port that should be advertised to the link partner when performing auto-negotiation: noFlowControl (1) - no flow control support in any direction asymTxFlowControlOnly (2) - STD 802.3x flow control frames can be sent from this port, but flow control packets received on it can not be processed. symFlowControlOnly (3) - STD 802.3x flow control frames must be supported in both directions symAndAsymRxFlowControl (4) - STD 802.3x flow control frames must be supported in both directions or at least received flowcontrol frames on this port can be processed.

scEthPortMulticastPktsSent.name: scEthPortMulticastPktsSent
scEthPortMulticastPktsSent.description: The total number of good packets sent by the port that were directed to a multicast address.

scEthPortUndersizePktsRec.name: scEthPortUndersizePktsRec
scEthPortUndersizePktsRec.description: The total number of packets received that were less than 64 octets long (excluding framing bits, but including FCS octets) and were otherwise well formed.

scEthPortFlowControl.name: scEthPortFlowControl
scEthPortFlowControl.description: The flow control mode of the port

scEthGroupTable.name: scEthGroupTable
scEthGroupTable.description: Table of attributes which define ethernet configuration information about a single SC based group.

scEthGroupEntry.name: scEthGroupEntry
scEthGroupEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing data about a single Group.

scEthGroupId.name: scEthGroupId
scEthGroupId.description: Unique Id of the group in the scEthGroupTable. Equals the number of the slot by which the group is accessed.

scEthGroupAutoPartitionEnable.name: scEthGroupAutoPartitionEnable
scEthGroupAutoPartitionEnable.description: Enables/Disables the Auto-Partition mechanism in all ports of this module.

scEthGroupFefiEnable.name: scEthGroupFefiEnable
scEthGroupFefiEnable.description: This item enables\disables the FEFI mechanism of all Fast-Ethernet PHY's in the module. It enables\disables both the transmission and the recognition of FEFI signals.
